extends java.lang.Object

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    private boolean checkSunk()
    Checks if the ship is sunk.
    ShipDTO getDTO()
    Creates a ShipDTO instance which has the same attributes as this instance of Ship.
    (package private) int getLength()
    Gets the length of the Ship.
    (package private) org.json.JSONObject getState()
    Returns a JSONObject instance containing the following values: pos: a JSONArray with the information returned by the method Position.getState(). orientation: an int which is either 0 or 1 indicating the ship's orientation. 0 means HORIZONTAL and 1 means VERTICAL. sunk: a Boolean that indicates wether the ship is sunk. placed: a Boolean that indicates wether the ship is placed. length: an int that represents the ship's length. hits: a JSONArray of Boolean values where each value represents a ship's position and takes value 1 if ship was hit there and value 0 otherwise.
    (package private) boolean getSunk()
    Returns if the ship is sunk.
    static Ship parse​(org.json.JSONObject object, Level level)
    Given the information contained in a JSONObject, this method creates an instance of Ship.
    (package private) void placeShip​(Position pos, Orientation o)
    Sets this ship as placed by changing its relevant attributes.
    (package private) java.util.List<java.lang.Boolean> receiveShot​(Position pos)
    Checks if a shot at a certain Position would hit this ship.

  • Method Details

    • parse

      public static Ship parse​(org.json.JSONObject object, Level level) throws GameParseException, org.json.JSONException
      Given the information contained in a JSONObject, this method creates an instance of Ship.
      Parameters:
      object - the JSONObject which contains the data.
      level - the Level that will be used to check if data is correct.
      Returns:
      the instance of Ship with its attributes set according to the provided data.
      Throws:
      GameParseException - if the provided data contains incorrect or inconsistent values.
      org.json.JSONException - if the JSONObject doesn't contain all needed keys.

    • getLength

      int getLength()
      Gets the length of the Ship.
      Returns:
      an int representing the ship's length.

    • getSunk

      boolean getSunk()
      Returns if the ship is sunk.
      Returns:
      true if the ship is sunk, false otherwise.

    • checkSunk

      private boolean checkSunk()
      Checks if the ship is sunk. If so, it changes its attribute sunk.
      Returns:
      true if the ship is sunk, false otherwise.

    • placeShip

      void placeShip​(Position pos, Orientation o)
      Sets this ship as placed by changing its relevant attributes.
      Parameters:
      pos - the ship's Position.
      o - the ship's Orientation

    • receiveShot

      java.util.List<java.lang.Boolean> receiveShot​(Position pos)
      Checks if a shot at a certain Position would hit this ship.
      Parameters:
      pos - the Position to check.
      Returns:
      a List containing two Boolean values indicating if the ship has been hit and if it has been sunk.

    • getState

      org.json.JSONObject getState()
      Returns a JSONObject instance containing the following values:
      • pos: a JSONArray with the information returned by the method Position.getState().
      • orientation: an int which is either 0 or 1 indicating the ship's orientation. 0 means HORIZONTAL and 1 means VERTICAL.
      • sunk: a Boolean that indicates wether the ship is sunk.
      • placed: a Boolean that indicates wether the ship is placed.
      • length: an int that represents the ship's length.
      • hits: a JSONArray of Boolean values where each value represents a ship's position and takes value 1 if ship was hit there and value 0 otherwise.
      Returns:
      a JSONObject with said values.

    • getDTO

      public ShipDTO getDTO()
      Creates a ShipDTO instance which has the same attributes as this instance of Ship.
      Returns:
      a ShipDTO created from this ship.
